page.title: 03St Mary's R.C.School,Barton
page.content:
St Mary's School was opened in 1863 in a building adjacent to the railway station in the Newsham area of Barton. The word Â£Newsham' means Â£at the New Houses' and both school and church are often referred to as Â£Newhouse'.
In 1907 a new school was built nearer the church. The present junior classrooms were built in 1957 and 1963 and the infant block was added in 1970 thus freeing the 1907 section for use as a hall and dining room.
The school serves the Roman Catholic parish of St Mary's. Children from Barton, Broughton, Woodplumpton and surrounding areas attend the school.
